data.title: Pope Greenwich Village by Patrick Vincent
data.meta_description: The Pope of Greenwich Village by Vincent patrick and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Paperback. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. May have limited writing in cover pages. Pages are unmarked. ~ ThriftBooks: Read More, Spend Less 0.1.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Novel. First edition stated. Book near fine and clean, light bumps to the corners and spine ends. Dust jacket lightly rubbed, wear on the tips.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. 12mo - over 6¾ - 7¾" tall. Quarter red cloth, green paper boards. 280 pp. Spine slightly cocked, fading to extremities. Dust jacket is bumped and sunned to extremities, a few light damp stains to spine.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. First Edition. Patrick's first book, a novel about small-time hustlers in New York City. The 1984 film version starred Mickey Rourke and Eric Roberts. Fine in very good plus dustjacket with light edge wear, price-clipped.

Soft cover. Condition: Fine. Advance Reading Copy. FINE condition in NEAR FINE original paper wraps. NY. Seaview Books. ADVANCE READING COPY as issued by Publishers for hardcover edition, October 1979. AS NEW, bound in original glossy orange heavy paper wraps, no dust jacket as issued. Square and tight, UNREAD, NO creasing. Covers have light rubbing outside and light toning to inside. Stored in Archival sleeve.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First British. Very good or better in very good dustwrapper; Book and dustwrapper show slight rubbing of spine/panels. Please Note: This book has been transferred to Between the Covers from another database and might not be described to our usual standards. Please inquire for more detailed condition information.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First edition. Spine ends lightly bumped, else near fine in a very good dustwrapper with significant scuffing to panels. Made into a film in 1984 starring Mickey Rourke, Eric Roberts, Daryl Hannah, Geraldine Page, Kenneth McMillan and Burt Young.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First edition. Tiny tears at the bottom margin of several pages, small stain on bottom edge, very good in a very good dust jacket with a few short tears, and a slightly toned spine. Basis for the 1984 American black comedy film of the same name directed by Stuart Rosenberg and starring Mickey Rourke, Eric Roberts, Daryl Hannah, Geraldine Page, Kenneth McMillan and Burt Young.

First edition. Hardcover. First printing. Patrick's first novel, the basis for a movie with Eric Roberts, Mickey Rourke, Daryl Hannah, and Geraldine Page. A very near fine copy in a close to near fine dust jacket with a few small edge tears, one of which is at the top of the spine.

HARDCOVER. Condition: NEAR FINE. Dust Jacket Condition: NEAR FINE. USA: SEAVIEW BOOKS, 1979. NEAR FINE/NEAR FINE. USA: SEAVIEW BOOKS, 1979. NEAR FINE/NEAR FINE. USA: SEAVIEW BOOKS, 1979. NEAR FINE/NEAR FINE. Seaview Books, USA, 1979, hardcover, 2nd printing, near fine book, near fine cover, not remaindered, book club or library, unclipped jacket, unmarked, mylar cover, appears unread 2ND PRINTING.

Script Format, reprint. Condition: As New. / 1981 4TH DRAFT / I HAVE MORE TITLES, LET ME KNOW IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR OTHER TITLES /THE SCRIPT IS PRINTED ON THREE-HOLE PUNCHED PAPER AND BOUND WITH 2 BRASS BRADS /.

First Edition. First Printing. Octavo. (21.5 cm.); red cloth covered spine over green paper-covered boards, stamped in gilt on cover and spine; dustjacket; 280pp. Fine. The dustjacket is unclipped (priced $9.95); short closed tear to top of front panel; Near Fine. "Acutely realistic yet wondrously funny, The Pope of Greenwich Village captures the speech, the scams, the flavor, the dread and the humor of ordinary people scrambling to make it big in a neighborhood that prides itself on creating and enforcing it's own laws." (from the dustjacket).
